intro: Hieracium boliviense subsp. tucumanicum, commonly known as the Tucumán hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, basal rosettes of leaves. Native to South America, particularly in Argentina and Bolivia, it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, daisy-like inflorescences. It is often found in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
